lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Returns a String representing the command Add.
public Deadlines(String description, int num, String time) {
* Returns a String representing the command Deadlines.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + "[D][ ] " + this.command + "(by: " + time + ")\n"
+ "Now you have " + this.num + " tasks in the list.";
* Returns a String representing the command Delete.
return "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + this.command + "\n" + "Now you have " + this.num + " tasks in the list.";
* Represents a robot which can react to different commands.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* PrintCommand function to print out the current command.
* Returns a String representation of the command list.
* Returns a String representation of the message.
public Events(String description, int num, String time) {
* Returns a String representation of the command.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + "[E][ ] " + this.command + "(at: " + time + ")\n"
+ "Now you have " + this.num + " tasks in the list.";
* Checks if the command should be added to the list.
* Returns a String representation of the command.
return "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n" + getList();
* Checks if the command should be added to the list.
* Returns a String representation of the command.
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + this.command.substring(0, 3) + "[X]" + this.command.substring(6);
* Represents a storage that stores the command list.
* Stores the current list command in the file.
* @param list A list of String type.
public void push(String list) throws IOException {
* Returns a String representation of the list.
* Deals with different commands. Adds different commands to an arrayList.
* Returns a String representing the command Delete.
* @throws DukeException if duke cannot identify the command.
public static Task of (String command, ArrayList<String> arrayList, int number) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Checks if the command should be added to the list.
* Returns a String representation of the command.
* Sets the list to be current list.
* @param list A list that is of type String.

* Returns a String representation of the command.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + "[T][ ] " + this.command + "\n" + "Now you have " + this.num + " tasks in the list.";

* Returns a String representation of the command.
return "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + this.command.substring(0, 3) + "[ ]" + this.command.substring(6);
